common

Class RandomAccessByteReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractByteReader
      • common.RandomAccessByteReader

  • public class RandomAccessByteReader
extends AbstractByteReader
    This class performs reader operations intended for obtaining data from a byte array at random.

    Change History:

    • Version 1.0 - Initial release by Trevor Maggs on 21 June 2025
    Since:
    21 June 2025
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs, trevmaggs@tpg.com.au

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf)
      Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing the payload data to be read from the beginning of the array.
      RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf, java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Constructs an instance to store the byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly.
      RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf, int offset)
      Constructs an instance to store a byte array that contains payload or raw data.
      RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf, int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getDouble64(int index)
      Retrieves 8 bytes from the byte array and returns the result as a double value, based on the current byte ordering.
      float getFloat32(int index)
      Retrieves 4 bytes from the byte array and returns the result as a float value, based on the current byte ordering.
      byte readByte(int index)
      Reads a single byte at the specified position in the byte array.
      byte[] readBytes(int index, int length)
      Reads up to the length of a sub-array starting at the specified position in the byte array.
      int readInteger(int index)
      Reads four bytes at the specified position and returns the result as a signed integer (32-bit) value, based on the current byte ordering.
      long readLong(int index)
      Returns an 8-byte value as a signed long, based on the current byte ordering.
      short readShort(int index)
      Reads two bytes at the specified position and returns the result as a short (16-bit) signed value, based on the current byte ordering.
      short readUnsignedByte(int index)
      Reads an unsigned 8-bit integer at the specified position in the byte array.
      long readUnsignedInteger(int index)
      Reads four bytes at the specified position and returns the result as an unsigned value, based on the current byte ordering.
      int readUnsignedShort(int index)
      Reads two bytes from the specified position and returns the result as an unsigned value, based on the current byte ordering.

        getBaseOffset, getByte, getByteOrder, getBytes, length, peek, peek, printRawBytes, setByteOrder

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomAccessByteReader

        public RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf)
        Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing the payload data to be read from the beginning of the array.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes that acts as a buffer within this instance

      • RandomAccessByteReader

        public RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf,
                              java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Constructs an instance to store the byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly. The data will be read from the beginning of the array.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes acting as the buffer for this instance
        order - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

      • RandomAccessByteReader

        public RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf,
                              int offset)
        Constructs an instance to store a byte array that contains payload or raw data. The data will be read from the specified offset within the array.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes that acts as a buffer for this instance
        offset - specifies the starting position within the specified array

      • RandomAccessByteReader

        public RandomAccessByteReader(byte[] buf,
                              int offset,
                              java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly. The offset specifies the starting position within the array to be read from.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes acting as the buffer for this instance
        offset - specifies the starting position within the specified array
        order - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

    • Method Detail

      • readByte

        public byte readByte(int index)
        Reads a single byte at the specified position in the byte array.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified position

      • readUnsignedByte

        public short readUnsignedByte(int index)
        Reads an unsigned 8-bit integer at the specified position in the byte array. The returned value is a short type to allow the unsigned byte to be returned without any form of data corruption.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified position, which can have a value ranging from 0 to 255

      • readBytes

        public byte[] readBytes(int index,
                        int length)
        Reads up to the length of a sub-array starting at the specified position in the byte array.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        length - the total number of bytes in the sub-array
        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the specified subset of the original array

      • readShort

        public short readShort(int index)
        Reads two bytes at the specified position and returns the result as a short (16-bit) signed value, based on the current byte ordering.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        a signed short 2-byte value

      • readUnsignedShort

        public int readUnsignedShort(int index)
        Reads two bytes from the specified position and returns the result as an unsigned value, based on the current byte ordering. The return value is an integer type to allow the unsigned short to be returned without truncation.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        an unsigned integer value

      • readInteger

        public int readInteger(int index)
        Reads four bytes at the specified position and returns the result as a signed integer (32-bit) value, based on the current byte ordering.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        a signed integer value

      • readUnsignedInteger

        public long readUnsignedInteger(int index)
        Reads four bytes at the specified position and returns the result as an unsigned value, based on the current byte ordering. The return value is a long type to allow the unsigned integer to be returned without truncation.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        an unsigned long value

      • readLong

        public long readLong(int index)
        Returns an 8-byte value as a signed long, based on the current byte ordering.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        an 8-byte signed long value

      • getFloat32

        public float getFloat32(int index)
        Retrieves 4 bytes from the byte array and returns the result as a float value, based on the current byte ordering.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        a float value extracted from the byte array

      • getDouble64

        public double getDouble64(int index)
        Retrieves 8 bytes from the byte array and returns the result as a double value, based on the current byte ordering.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the first byte in the sub-array
        Returns:
        a double value extracted from the byte array
